main event: On 9 January 1956, at 1840 EST in Miami, Florida, a civilian witnessed a small round white glowing object, about the size of a dime at arm's length, with a tail 5 or 6 times longer than the object, moving from NE to SW at a slower speed than a meteor with no sound.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 3 seconds and was described as slower than a meteor, with no sound being emitted by the object.
The witness described the object as a small round white glowing orb with a tail that was significantly longer than the object.
The observation took place in Miami, Florida, with clear and unlimited visibility and winds reported at 25 to ███ ███ ft WNW 90kts.
No photographs were taken during the sighting, and the source of the report was a civilian witness.
The conclusion on the document indicated that the observed object was 'Probably a Meteor', despite the witness describing it as having unique characteristics.
sighted object: small round white glowing object with a long tail
